Pros:
-It is one of the best competitive shooters of all time. 
That's about it, honestly. 

Cons:
-Literally you will have the most toxic interactions with people almost every match. Your teammates all went and died in the first 45 seconds of the round? Get ready to be backseat gamed the entirety of that round and be told how stupid any decision you make is. Make head holes instead of foot holes? You probably should have been aborted. 
-Bullets come out of your forehead on this game, so you put your head against the wall and hold ridiculous peeks no one will ever be able to defend against. It's not fun gameplay.
-The Map and Operator bans in ranked make the game stale. You can play for 3 hours and you'll play the same 3-4 maps on repeat with the exact same 4-6 operators banned. 
-Cheating is RAMPANT in higher ranked lobbies. Get ready to get tracked through walls constantly. 
-Speaking of cheating: Say you get into a ranked game or standard match and there's a cheater on your team or the other team. That's 30+ minutes of your life lost because you're teammates won't surrender because they "want to beat the cheater" for whatever stupid reason, and if you leave you get banned. 
-I have a billion hours in this game, and I don't have all the operators unlocked. I took quite a break, but I have well over 100 since I've been back and I still am missing 3-4 of the new ones. 
-Wooo! Battlepass with skins no one will want. 

I wish I had these 1400+ hours back.

Imagine yourself on the edge of your seat, heart pounding as you breach a barricaded door, your senses heightened and adrenaline surging through your veins. Welcome to the captivating world of Rainbow Six Siege, a tactical first-person shooter that is not just a game; it's an exhilarating experience that will redefine your perception of online multiplayer. Picture this: you and your elite team of operators, each with unique abilities and gadgets, are tasked with outsmarting an equally skilled team of adversaries in a high-stakes showdown. The game's unparalleled realism and attention to detail immerse you in the heart-pounding action, where every bullet fired and every wall breached has strategic consequences. The destructible environments add a layer of unpredictability, forcing you to think on your feet and adapt to the dynamic battlefield. Rainbow Six Siege is a symphony of strategy, teamwork, and chaos, where no two matches are ever the same. The intensity of the firefights, the intricate maps, and the sheer satisfaction of executing a perfectly coordinated plan make Rainbow Six Siege not just a game, but a pulse-pounding adventure that will keep you coming back for more. It's a thrilling roller coaster of tactical brilliance and heart-stopping moments that will leave you hooked from the very first breach. Get ready to lose yourself in the immersive world of Rainbow Six Siege, where every match is a story waiting to unfold, and every victory is a testament to your skill and teamwork.

Rainbow Six is, in my opinion, the best Hero-Shooter that currently exists on the market.

To begin with, visually it looks fantastic since the graphics are incredible and it is very pleasant to see the level of detail that exists in the maps to the point of placing everything that a house, restaurant, plane, etc. has in real life.

Another thing that I loved is the gameplay, since even after 7 years since its launch, not a single game has come out that is similar to it, in Rainbow Six you can destroy walls, reinforce them so that they do not break them, place traps and have a very tactical gameplay where you have to know how to position yourself and even with all this the truth is that the game is very fun.... in the rest within the gameplay it has everything that a hero-shooter can have, where each character has his own weapons (which you can customize like in COD) and his own abilities, only here there are no famous "Ultis" with the novelty that in this game all the characters are humans from different countries, not like in other games where There are also robotic characters or even science fiction animals and beings.

The game, even despite the time it has been on the market, continues to be constantly updated, adding new characters, battle passes, maps, etc.

Maybe the only bad thing I've seen is that its community is quite toxic... if you make a small mistake there are players who even kill you in the next round because of the anger you caused them (and not just a mistake, if for any reason If you make them angry, they can kill you or report you).

It also has a very disastrous anti-cheat system and that ruins the playability of some players, much more so in ranks.

In short, a highly recommended game in case you don't like other hero-shooters like Valorant or Overwtach.... or if you are simply interested in something more competitive.
